intro: Pelecyphora laredoi, commonly known as the Laredo pelecyphora, is a rare and unique plant species native to the mountainous regions of northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Pelecyphora laredoi thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
